marzia.name: Atty. Marzia Amaranto
marzia.education: Law Degree with specialization in International Law. Thesis in Criminal Law: 'Transnational Crime'.
marzia.expertise: Civil law, family law, medical liability (Gelli-Bianco Law), traffic accidents, damages compensation, condominium law, driver's license recovery, forced execution.
marzia.experience: She has gained solid experience in protecting citizens' rights, with particular focus on medical-healthcare disputes. She manages client relationships with special attention to medical malpractice cases, license recovery, and defense in disproportionate seizure cases.
marzia.publications: Published articles in Cammino Diritto journal and collaborated with Il Riformista (2023-2024) on justice and rights issues, making legal language accessible to the general public.
marzia.qualifications: Master's in Corporate Law (2020) - Member of the Pisa Bar Association - Practices throughout Italy

antonio.name: Atty. Antonio Amaranto
antonio.education: Law Degree from the University of Padua. Specialized thesis in White-Collar Criminal Law.
antonio.expertise: Criminal law, white-collar crime, labor law, military law, administrative and social security matters.
antonio.experience: He has consolidated specific competencies through a comprehensive specialization path. His approach, based on an integrated and multidisciplinary vision of law, combines technical expertise with the ability to adapt to the specific needs of each case.
antonio.recognition: Recognized as a high-profile expert and key figure in the firm for his thorough understanding of legal norms and procedural practices, both in judicial and out-of-court matters.
antonio.qualifications: Post-graduate specialization in White-Collar Criminal Law - Practices throughout Italy with focus on criminal and military proceedings
